meanings.definition: The office or building in which a consul conducts business.
meanings.sent1: The consulate was a busy place with people coming in and out all day.
meanings.sent2: I need to visit the consulate to get my passport renewed.
meanings.sent3: The consulate was so crowded that it felt like a beehive of activity.
meanings.sent4: In the heart of the city, the consulate stood like a fortress of diplomacy.
meanings.sent5: The bright red sign of the consulate made it easy to spot among the other buildings.

meanings.definition: The position or authority of a consul.
meanings.sent1: She held the consulate with grace and dignity.
meanings.sent2: The consulate's decision was final in matters of trade agreements.
meanings.sent3: The consulate's authority was so great that even the mayor respected it.
meanings.sent4: In the world of diplomacy, the consulate's power was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The consulate's influence spread far and wide, shaping international relations.

meanings.definition: The residence or official residence of a consul.
meanings.sent1: The consulate was a beautiful mansion overlooking the sea.
meanings.sent2: Living in the consulate, the consul enjoyed a luxurious lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The consulate's garden was filled with colorful flowers and exotic plants.
meanings.sent4: The lights in the consulate at night made it look like a fairy-tale castle.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the consulate felt like stepping into a different world of elegance and sophistication.
